info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 20 at 1:13PM EDT until March 24 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Wakefield VA
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Wakefield VA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Virginia...
Blackwater River Above Franklin affecting Southampton, City of Suffolk, Isle of Wight and City of Franklin Counties.
For the Chowan Basin...including Sebrell, Franklin...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Blackwater River above Franklin.
* WHEN...From Friday morning to early Monday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 10.8 feet, A portion of Barretts Landing River Walk is innundated in Downtown Franklin area. At 11.8 feet, A portion of State Route 611 in Southampton County, Joyners Bridge Road, is innundated. A portion of State Route 619, in Isle of Wight County, is flooded.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:45 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 10.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 6.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 11.6 feet Saturday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 10.8 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.7 feet on 01/20/2013. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued late tonight at 100 AM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING TO EARLY MONDAY MORNING

area.areaDesc: Isle of Wight, VA; Southampton, VA; City of Franklin, VA; City of Suffolk, VA
